article.headline: Pepperdine 70, Pacific 60
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. -- Keion Bell scored a game-high 25 points and Pepperdine rallied from a 19-point deficit Wednesday night to defeat Pacific 70-60. Bell led a 30-5 run that put Pepperdine in command after the Waves trailed 27-8 late in the first half. That was Pacific's biggest lead of the season. Mychel Thompson had 12 points and nine rebounds for Pepperdine (3-5). Taylor Darby scored 11 and Lorne Jackson 10. Sam Willard had 18 points and 10 rebounds for the Tigers (4-3), his sixth double-double in seven games this season. Allen Huddleston scored 14 points off the bench, and Demetrece Young had 10. Pacific was within 60-56 with 2 minutes to play, but its bench was whistled for a technical foul after Willard was called for charging. Bell made the two technical free throws, and the Waves' lead never fell below seven points the rest of the way.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
